    • Method Detail

      • postStopTimes

        public static java.lang.String postStopTimes(java.lang.Object stop,
                                             org.json.JSONObject json,
                                             boolean is24Hour,
                                             java.lang.String expectedArrivalString,
                                             java.lang.String expectedDepartureString,
                                             java.lang.String overflowString)
        Posts the time string for the selected stop, which contains when the (selected) buses for that stop will be arriving and departing. This method also posts this string to the body of the popup window when the info window is clicked on.
        Parameters:
        stop - The stop (either an actual Stop object, or a SharedStop).
        json - The json object retrieved from the RouteMatch server.
        is24Hour - Whether or not the user is using 24 hour time.
        expectedArrivalString - The expected arrival string resource.
        expectedDepartureString - The expected departure string resource.
        overflowString - The string resource used to notify the user to click on the info window when there is too much content to be displayed.
        Returns:
        The string containing either all the arrival and departure times for the stop, or the overflowString if there is too much data.

      • onCircleClick

        public void onCircleClick(com.google.android.gms.maps.model.Circle circle)
        Called when a circle is clicked.

        This is called on the Android UI thread.

        Specified by:
        onCircleClick in interface com.google.android.gms.maps.GoogleMap.OnCircleClickListener
        Parameters:
        circle - The circle that is clicked.
